name: Al Qasr at Madinat Jumeirah

reviews.text: I would not qualify this hotel and resort as a "luxury hotel" but more as an "upscale family hotel". If it would not be for my kid, I would not come back. But if you have children, this hotel is a good choice : it is a 5 stars class hotel which gives you rather good value for money (especially in summer when room rates are 1/3 of regular rates in winter), it is very conveniently located on the beach, next to the water park Wild Wadi (entrance is free for Jumeirah hotels' guests), with a mall inside (Souk Madinat). The buildings and installations are very good. The service is also quite OK. There are all sorts of restaurants located inside the resorts that you surely can find one or more that suit your taste. Personnally I would recommend the Chinese restautant named "Zheng He" and the Thai restaurant named "Pai Thai". The Spa installation is also fine.
reviews.title: Family upscale hotel

reviews.text: So at the end, what do I dislike in this hotel ? Well, the fact that it is too big that it can never provide the privacy and the exclusiveness that hotels such as Four Seasons or One & Only could provide. Just stay on the beach or by the pool or go to the breakfast restaurant at peak hours and you will understand immediately what I mean.
reviews.title: So Nice!!
Still Love it
reviews.text: Super nice hotel, beautiful pool and beach, great food!! Loved the breakfast buffet at restaurant near the beach. Great resort for all ages - my kids loved riding in the boats that run throughout the property.
All I can say it was fantastic. Has been there for the last 3 years and will go back for more.
reviews.title: Best in Dubai

likes.liked: — Five star luxury, beachfront location, canals and big pool

reviews.text: Just love it!!!!
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.text: Having stayed at many Jumeirah properties, I feel that this one is the best. I stayed at this hotel in the middle of July for 5 nights. I was there for a family holiday with three adults in a ocean deluxe room with one massive king size bed and a pull out sofa bed. This hotel only allows a maximum of three adults in a room.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Dubai

reviews.text: Having arrived at Dubai airport quite late at night, around midnight we were greeted by the hotel representative who was very friendly and showed us to our awaiting car. The representative meets you just before passport control and helps you through the long queue and then collects your baggage. This service is only available if you pay extra or you are staying in a suit.
reviews.title: Woot! Hilarious.

reviews.text: As this was my first time in the Al Qasr. I was amazed by the lovely entrance to the hotel. The bronze horses you see at the front of the hotel are magnificent. Having arrived so late at the hotel on a Sunday night, it felt as if we were the only guests at the hotel. The guys at the front of the hotel who open the car doors for you and take your luggage are very nice, one staff member who should be credited is a African guy called ‘Macilli’ who was very friendly and welcoming through-out our stay, you cant miss this guy as he is like 7feet tall.
reviews.title: Great luxury family hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check in for the hotel is very 5*. You sit on a couch while the staff pamper you with nice cold towels and refreshments while you are being checked in. one thing that I really liked is that once you have checked in, you are personally taken to your room by one off the hotel staff which is quite nice.
reviews.title: Wonderful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room it self is very spacious. The bed in the room is massive and is very comfortable. The room also has a range off pillows that you can choose from if you are fussy like that. The décor in the room is very old Dubai, but is made to look modern which works really well. The bathroom is big with a nice tub and big shower. I have also stayed in the Dar Al Masyaf which has a bigger bathroom but the room isn’t as big. The room is very well stocked with toiletries and the only thing you need to bring with you are toothpaste and sunscreen.
reviews.title: Terrible Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was great, and it works so well being such a huge resort. You will not need to go out any where, as there is so much to do.
reviews.title: Oh YES!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to wait about 45 minutes for our room as we were slightly early. They sent us to a waiting area…… More like a health spa! It was relaxing, with big leather chairs, a huge shower area and light refreshments.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very big with great comfy beds. We got a room with sea view which looked out on to the gulf sea, however we were not in the room that much so would say that a normal room would be just as good. The bathroom had more toiletries then Boots and Superdrug put together! Fantastic.
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast time could be a tad buys but there is everything you could wish for to eat at breakfast.
reviews.title: our amazing honeymoon!

likes.disliked: — the other tourists were very posh and at times rude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The private beach is like something out of a dream. So clean, comfortable beds, chairs, staff bringing you fresh fruit and ice lollypops, towels before you can even think of it.
reviews.title: Unbelievable, comfortable, luxury

likes.liked: — whole package, hotel plus food plus staff WORKS!

reviews.text: The hotel is built like a palace and no expense has been spared on the interiors or the exteriors, giving it a royal and pleasant effect, unlike the ostentatious and over-the-top interiors of the Burj Al Arab close by.
reviews.title: Excellent place, fabulous staff (except one chap at the reception)

likes.disliked: — Expensive Food & Drink, rude reception guy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being a part of the Madinat Jumeirah complex, you have full and free access to the pools, restaurants and entertainment at Al Qasr, Mina Salam, Jumeirah Beach Hotel, and the Wild Wadi Water park. You can also visit the Burj at set hours during the day.
reviews.title: out of this world!!!!! loved it loved it loved it!!!!

likes.disliked: — nothing. There was nothing to fault.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is clean and inviting, but too calm for my liking - no waves at all.
reviews.title: Ancient Charm, Modern Facilities, Royal Treatment

likes.disliked: — A little expensive...and the HOT and DRY weather...

reviews.text: The Souk has a lot of shopping and dining options, though almost all are pretty expensive.
reviews.title: one of the best hotels ever

reviews.text: The staff are well-trained, with everyone from the doorman to the secruity to the maintenance guys being extremely polite and helpful.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, great service, great staff.

aka: Al Qasr At Madinat Jumeirah Hotel Dubai
